perturbation.original_text: This Website Design, Development and Hosting Agreement the ("Agreement") is entered into on January 11, 2018 by and between Natalija Tunevic, director of FreeCook (hereinafter referred to as "Client") and Mitchell Vitalis, director of Mitchell's Web Advance, PLC (hereinafter referred to as "Company").
perturbation.changed_text: This Website Design, Development and Hosting Agreement the ("Agreement") is entered into on January 11, 2018 by and between Natalija Tunevic, director of FreeCook (hereinafter referred to as "Client") and Mitchell Vitalis, director of Mitchell's Web Advance, PLC (hereinafter referred to as "Service Provider").
perturbation.explanation: Changing "Company" to "Service Provider" introduces confusion, as "Company" is defined as Mitchell's Web Advance, PLC, but later sections still refer to "Company," creating ambiguity about which entity those sections apply to.

perturbation.original_text: Client agrees to pay to Company the sum of $5,000 (the "Contract Price") to design and develop a website for Client (the "Client Website") in accordance with the accompanying Scope of Work, attached to this Agreement as Exhibit A.
perturbation.changed_text: Client agrees to pay to Company the sum of $5,000 (the "Project Cost") to design and develop a website for Client (the "Client Website") in accordance with the accompanying Scope of Work, attached to this Agreement as Exhibit A.
perturbation.explanation: Changing "Contract Price" to "Project Cost" creates uncertainty. The agreement later refers to "Contract Price" when discussing change orders. Since the document does not clarify whether "Project Cost" and "Contract Price" are interchangeable, a dispute may arise concerning which price governs additional work.

perturbation.original_text: 4. Customer Service. Company, either directly or through its authorized service provider, shall provide customer service (the "Customer Service") relating to Client Website consisting of replying to customer questions or complaints regarding website hosting services during the normal business hours set forth. Company is not obligated to provide any Customer Service except as specified in this Section. Company at its sole discretion may at any time alter or cease providing the Customer Service which it has agreed to provide to Client relating to Client Website pursuant to this Agreement without any liability to Company.
perturbation.changed_text: 4. Customer Service. Service Provider, either directly or through its authorized service provider, shall provide technical support (the "Customer Service") relating to Client Website consisting of replying to customer questions or complaints regarding website hosting services during the normal business hours set forth. Company is not obligated to provide any Customer Service except as specified in this Section. Mitchell's Web Advance at its sole discretion may at any time alter or cease providing the Customer Service which it has agreed to provide to Client relating to Client Website pursuant to this Agreement without any liability to Company.
perturbation.explanation: Here, we've replaced 'Company' with 'Service Provider', 'technical support' to 'customer service' and 'Company' with 'Mitchell's Web Advance' in different places. This creates confusion over which entities are responsible for certain obligation and potentially limits the scope of the covered service and which company is obligated to uphold it. Furthermore, it becomes unclear how this section ties back to the definition of 'Company' or the initially defined 'Service Provider', given that all 3 are now referenced.
